Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2012 09:12PM mishka wrote: Haha, your right about being careful of what u wish for. I always wanted implants but was waiting til I got a little older in case they caused problems. I didn't really want yo go THIS far.. I will never feel truely cancer free only because my cancer did not show up in the biopsy. I will learn to accept that and every year I have clears mammal will be encouraging I am sure... This is truely where I get my strength.

Bc may have taken away part of my spirit, but through a few ladies on these boards I also gained something. I realized how complete strangers from all over the world can pull together and give you something even the best intended family or friends cant. This part of my journey will always help me to understand that good can come out of a bad situation. Even BC. I am guarded because the dcis wad not found from the biopsy, that showed adh. It was the first lumpectomy pathology that found the dcis. I will be at ease when results are in from my next re excision.. arr you feeling better? Did the swelling go down yet? The MRI biopsy bruised nearly my whole boob again.. Posts.Title: 42 with questions Mindyandgang mishka

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2012 02:24AM - edited Sep 16, 2012 02:27AM by mishka Mindy, If it is wire localization prior to surgery that you are talking about it went well when I had it done prior to my lumpectomy. When I got there a nice lady gave me a pill and then proceeded to apply gentle compression with mamm machine while placing the wire in my left breast. They numb the area first. Then they put a coffee cup taped over it while you head up to surgery. As far as telling your younger kids. I told my older thee 19, 17, 15 and waited to tell my 9y/o daughter until after path report came back from lumpectomy. I sat down next to her on the couch while she was watching Tv. I started saying things like: youve heard of cancer right, you know how some cancers can make you real sick and some not so much, sometimes people loose there hair and sometimes not. She looked at me and said "why are you telling me all this? Pause "do you have cancer?" I looked at her, silent cause the words were stuck in my throat. Tears welled up in my eyes and I said "yes"..... I hugged her and I said I am fine these are not sad tears, it is just hard to tell you because I do not want you to worry. I told her it is very fixable and. I will be fine. I didn't want her yo overhear conversations and really be scared. >
Posts.Title: 42 with questions Mindyandgang mishka

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2012 10:52AM mishka wrote: Rachel-my doc did tell me on the phone when my surgical biopsy/lumpectomy results showed that I Have DCIS. I did go in for a consult with her two hours later to plan treatment. I had an MRI which showed a suspicions area which I am having a MRI guided biopsy on Sept. 19. I am having a re-excision the following week unless biopsy results indicate need for mastectomy. The waiting game stinks!!!!! Mindy-my surgery was not bad at all. They gave me a pill when I got there, got me ready for surgery and when I looked up the nice man put something in my iv bag. The next thing I know I was sitting up in bed with a can of pepsi and crackers waiting for me. I was alert and my husband and I went out for a big breakfast. I find surgery to be way better than the stereotactic needle biopsy......

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2012 10:04PM mishka wrote: Hi Mindy, Sorry your scan made you so sore. Was there compression? Pre op is a pain in the rear but unfortunately, nessessary. You have to be at the hospital early tomorrow. Did they say how long you would be there? Wow!!! You have been through a lot in your lifetime.... That is really sad about your boyfriend, sorry all that happened to you...Its not strange to think/expect the worse, it usually end up better that way. I was expecting today to be horrible with them compressing my Breast and sticking a needle in it with the large hematoma at that spot, but it wasn't bad. Pretty sore now but that's ok. Just don't like pain while they are doing stuff to me. The drain may be to prevent a hematoma. I wish I would have had a drain then I wouldn't have this large painful hematoma. Good luck tomorrow. Is surgery at 7? You are clearly a strong woman with all you have been through..... I will be thinking about you. Hope you see the nice man :)
Posts.Title: 42 with questions Mindyandgang mishka

Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2012 10:38AM mishka wrote: Mindy, I didn't tell my nine year old until I found out I had DCIS and was going to have another lumpectomy followed by radiation. There is no hurry until you have difinitive news if your not ready. I was trying yo tell my lil one in a positive, confident tone. When she asked I just caved. She is fine now and just wishes I didn't have cancer. I reassure her that I will be fine and she is happy with that... I was completely asleep for my lumpectomy. No memory of anything except the nice man putting something in my iv bag. I would rather have another lumpectomy with wire localization over the stereotactic biopsy. Did you have a needle biopsy? No magic pill or anything for that.............I found the lumpectomy to be ok. Good luck. After my first lumpectomy the doc scheduled me for an MRI to look at both Breast carefully. My right was good. Left side they found an area of concern from recent lumpectomy site to nipple area. May be from surgery but need an MRI biopsy to make sure. This wed at 6:40 am I will be having my biopsy.....

Posts.Content: Sep 19, 2012 12:36PM mishka wrote: Hi Mindy, It went well, not much discomfort-even with the hematoma. They went in right by the hematoma but I got4 shots of numbing meds. I asked for double. Worse part was when they had to apply pressure to stop the bleeding. She was pushing right on the hematoma. She said it can take MONTHS for the hrmatoma to be absorbed, ughhhhhh! They ace wrapped me and sent me on me way. Results by Monday. If no more cancer I will have a lumpectomy. If cancer, bilateral mast... I took one xanax before. Only. 25 Mg. Told doc I will need stronger dose for the waiting game ahead of me. Whet did they do for you per op today?
Posts.Title: 42 with questions Mindyandgang mishka

Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2012 04:36PM mishka wrote: Bruising is typical I think. My bruise was half of my Breast, bright yellow, red, black and blue. Never really saw that much color on any of my bruises. It is good that they put a drain in for you. Wish I knew more about hematomas beforehand. Do you have mch discomfort today? You did get a lot of good meds cause you sure slept a long time. That is funny cause I remember the face of my nice man too..., when I woke up I was very alert, went out for lunch and went to a football game to watch the band cause my son is a percussionist. I never felt sleepy. I too had a lot of swelling and still have half of it due to the hematoma :(. I just got done icing lefty.... I am scheduled for re excision on Oct 3rd with a cavity evaluation device. Hope you are feeling better soon.
